title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
job_description: Senior Software EngineerWho We AreWe’re doxy.me (doc-see-me), the world's most loved telemedicine solution, and we're on a mission to connect the world to the future of healthcare.We believe that cost and complexity should never be a barrier to telemedicine. That’s why we created a simple, free, and secure telemedicine platform. Since 2013, we’ve grown to more than 1 million healthcare providers from 180+ countries who have clocked over 8 billion minutes of telemedicine sessions to date.Our goal is to deliver the future of healthcare to every patient and healthcare professional on earth. Help us get there by joining our team of innovators, dreamers, and doers.We’re a remote-first company with regional hubs for in-person collaboration (Austin, TX, Boston, MA, Charleston, SC, Salt Lake City, UT & London, UK).Who You AreWe’re seeking a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer who is passionate about developing a core product that positively impacts the lives of people across the world whilst enabling healthcare professionals to perform as efficiently as possible.Our Free team builds features and functionality related to the call experience of the doxy.me platform.What You’ll DoOwn and deliver initiatives in service of quarterly goals for the Free Team. Work with the engineering team on frontend (~70%) and backend (~30%) tasks as a full-stack engineer (% are estimates and these could shift depending on quarterly deliverables)Participate in the whole cycle of feature development, from ideation to actual delivery. Perform code reviews and approval of changes. Play a key role on the Free team, contributing to areas that surround our core call capabilities and features. Your Skills And ExperienceYou have strong development and operations experience with React/Redux, Node.js, Javascript (ES6+), Typescript, CSS Frameworks, and RESTful APIs. You have an understanding of cloud-native architecture; ideally within AWS, though relevant experience in GCP, Azure or other cloud providers is also advantageous. You have experience building and architecting RESTful APIs and designing API integrations. You have an understanding of MySQL, relational databases, and data migration. You are passionate about UI/UX and customer-focused development. You are focused on quality, creating code that is readable, scalable and secure. You have the discipline to test changes thoroughly. What We Can Offer YouWe are new to the UK and, as such, our benefits are still being expanded upon; we’d love for you to contribute some ideas for benefits you feel could add value. Alongside a competitive salary, we can offer you;Unlimited PTO£2000 healthcare allowance to offset the cost of private medical insurance and/or any other medical costs you incur whether that’s dental, optical or even gym membershipRemote working - we have recently secured a small flexible office workspace in London Liverpool Street (here). Our current expectations are for teams to meet once per month in office; we would still anticipate a remote dominant environment going forwardCompany equipment (inc. latest laptop) + £500 spending allowance on equipment you can keepOur employees give us a 4.8 on Glassdoor. Interview process1st Stage - Screen with our internal recruiter2nd Stage - Chat with the Hiring Manager3rd Stage - Technical deep dive with two engineers4th Stage - Cross-functional interview followed by a conversation with our VP of EngineeringAdditional InformationDoxy.me tech stackFrontend: React, TypeScript, Playwright, WebRTC, Next.js, Nx.devBackend: Nodejs, TypeScript, Jest, NestJS, Nx.devCloud: AWS3rd party: Vonage, Pubnub, Segment, Twilio, StripeOur products:Doxy.me: The simple, free, and secure telemedicine solution currently used by over 1,000,000 doctors worldwide and helping over 350,000 patients/day. dokbot.io: Patient-focused data collection for healthcare. adhere.ly: Providing healthcare practitioners with the tools to ensure patients complete their course of treatmentOur team: technologists, academics, researchers, and innovators from all over the world. English is the language used in all internal communication. To ensure HIPAA compliance we perform background checks after extending a job offer

title: Manufacturing Engineer - Electric System
job_description: Scout MotorsHere at Scout Motors, we're carrying forward the heritage of one of the most iconic American vehicles in history. A vehicle dating back to 1960. One that forged the path for future generations of rugged SUVs and will do so once again.But Scout is more than just a brand, it’s a legacy steeped in a culture of exploration, caretaking, and hard work.Scout is all about respect. Respect for the environment by developing all-electric vehicles with the capability to get you to any location. Respect for the past and the future by taking an iconic American brand that hasn’t been around for a while, electrifying it, digitizing it, and loading it with American innovation. Respect for communities by creating a company that stands for its people and its customers. And respect for both work and play, with vehicles that are equally at home at a camp site, a job site, or on a Tuesday commute.At Scout Motors, we empower our talented, inclusive, and entrepreneurial teams to innovate. What makes a Scout? Someone who is a visionary and a leader, who seeks new paths and shares lessons learned. A knowledgeable doer who collaborates across the company to build better. A go-getter with unrivaled passion.Join us at Scout Motors and be part of shaping the future of transportation. If you're ready to drive change and make history, apply now!What you’ll doWithin the Manufacturing Engineering scope, Product Engineering evaluates, reports, and achieves manufacturability KPI’s by consulting with R&D on optimal product design.Success is achieved by intimate knowledge of product design, production process and project management. The “Manufacturing Engineering Energy System” is responsible for all parts in the HV and LV energy system, such as Thermal-Management System, HV-Battery and AC system. You will report to the Manager, Drive and Energy Systems at Production Planning.Become part of an iconic brand that is set to revolutionize the all-electric pick-up truck & rugged SUV marketplace by achieving the following:Your goal is to influence and improve technical concepts to achieve robust manufacturing conditions, implement manufacturing requirements and standards in technical concepts, validate manufacturing concepts and product design for high volume manufacturing. Collaborate with Process Planning, manufacturing, quality, production control, R&D engineering to provide product design and product concepts according to the needs of General Assembly and Battery Assembly. Use CAD-Data-Analysis, Simulations and virtual tests to identify risks for high volume manufacturing. Ensure that all products are designed to meet assembly requirements and that product design incorporates feasibility, buildability and ergonomics for high volume manufacturing with minimal rework in series production. Take responsibility for all communication between production, planning, manufacturing and engineering department as Single point of contact for all vehicle design / concept related topics. Use cross-departmental collaboration to meet and exceed company goals and objectives in manufacturing design. Coordinating activities within the team that outline and achieve project goals. Providing instruction and guidance about required techniques and regulations. Location & Travel Expectations: The responsibilities of this role require attendance at in-person meetings and events regularly. You’ll be comfortable with change and flexible in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. You’ll take a collaborative approach to achieve ambitious goals. title: Corelight Cyber Security Engineer
job_description: About UsDLH delivers improved health and national security readiness solutions for federal programs through science research and development, systems engineering and integration, and digital transformation. Our experts in public health, performance evaluation, and health operations solve the complex problems faced by civilian and military customers alike by leveraging advanced tools – including digital transformation, artificial intelligence, data analytics, cloud enablement, modeling, and simulation, and more. With over 3,200 employees dedicated to the idea that “Your Mission is Our Passion,” -DLH brings a unique combination of government sector experience, proven methodology, and unwavering commitment to innovation to improve the lives of millions.OverviewAs a Cyber Security Engineer (Corelight), you will be responsible for the development, tuning, management, and deployment of the Corelight Application in support of Network Detect and Respond activities. This role also involves designing, implementing, and managing security solutions, conducting vulnerability assessments, and responding to security incidents. The Cybersecurity Engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enforce security policies, procedures, and best practices to mitigate risks and protect the organization from cyber threats.  This role has potential for full remote with occasional travel (5%) for meetings and customer support (Charleston, Honolulu, Stuttgart).Responsibilities Be the primary subject matter expert for the Corelight application, leading implementation and maintenance, and training teammates in appropriate use  Analyze existing Incident Response and other policies, processes, procedures, and technologies  Participates in architecture design and analysis work related to security automation  Develop Custom Integrations  Conduct stakeholder interviews  Facilitate interactive working sessions addressing challenging topics  Draft and revise deliverables according to feedback.  Catalog and review any identified security automation use cases with stakeholders  Lead automation use case/playbook design sessions  Monitor security systems for signs of intrusion, abnormal activities, or vulnerabilities and take appropriate actions to mitigate risks  Develop and execute remediation plans to address identified security issues  Engage in incident response efforts in the event of a cybersecurity breach, including containment, analysis, and resolution  Develop, enforce, and update security policies, procedures, and standards to align with industry best practices and compliance requirements  Promote a culture of security awareness and proactive risk mitigation  Stay up-to-date with emerging threats and trends in the cybersecurity landscape  Incorporate threat intelligence into security strategies and defenses  Collaborate with IT teams, system administrators, and developers to integrate security into the software development lifecycle and infrastructure design Qualifications  US Citizen  At least 1 year of experience as a Corelight engineer  At least 1 years of experience analyzing Web Traffic Requests  At least 2 years of experience using a Log Aggregator  At least 3 years of experience using Suricata, Snort, and/or Zeek Preferred Qualifications 2+ years Hands on Experience with Corelight  1+ years Hands on Experience with Palo Alto Cortex, ServiceNow, Splunk, Sentinel, MDE is a plus  Detailed knowledge of the automation of cloud, on premise and hybrid environments  Possesses an understanding of cyber-attack techniques, vulnerabilities, and countermeasures  Experience in one or more scripting languages: Python, Powershell, or others  Strong written and verbal communication skills  Certifications  DoD 8570 and CNDSP IR compliant certifications  Benefits: DLH Corp offers our employees an excellent benefits package including - Personal Time Off (PTO), medical, dental, vision, supplemental life with AD&D, short and long-term disability, flexible spending accounts, parental leave, legal services and more. We want our employees to save for their future, therefore we offer a 401(k) Retirement Plan, which includes a matching component. DLH is dedicated to your career development, providing training to help drive success, with access to our best-in-class e-Learning suite for formal and informal learning, professional and technical certification preparation, and education assistance at accredited institutions.EEOWomen, minorities, individuals with disabilities and Veterans are encouraged to apply. DLH Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.DLH will provide a reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities and disable Veterans who need assistance to apply.

title: Azure Cloud Software Developer and Engineer
job_description: Job ID 2404985-3542Location CHARLESTON, SC, USDate Posted 2024-04-04Category Information TechnologySubcategory Cloud Comp EngrSchedule Full-timeShift Day JobTravel NoMinimum Clearance Required Interim SecretClearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain SecretPotential for Remote Work NoDescriptionSAIC is seeking an Azure Cloud Software Developer and Engineer to join the Cloud One Operations and Sustainment Team to work in Impact Level 2/4/5/6. This candidate will be part of a team responsible for the architecture design/planning, automation, management, support, and oversight of the Cloud One Azure environments. This position is 100% onsite to work in a SIPRnet facility. The Azure Cloud Software Developer and Engineer will be supporting the Cloud One Common Computing Environment (CCE) program under the Air Force Lifecycle Management Center Office for Network Integration (AFLCMC/HNI). Cloud One is an existing global, interconnected, virtualized, hybrid, and IT infrastructure hosting mission systems, applications, services, and data that will serve the U.S. Air Force (USAF) and U.S. Army (USA). Cloud One incorporates the capabilities of commercial cloud and Managed Service Providers (MSP) residing in Cloud Service Providers (CSPs). Cloud One facilitates the USAF and USA’s efforts to migrate applications to a cloud environment, allowing the closure of data centers to support the Data Center Optimization Initiative (DCOI) and allowing for increased efficiencies across the entire spectrum of the USAF and USA's IT operations.Daily activities may includeDesign, sustain, maintain, Azure environments and topologies, all aspectsProactively identify and resolve operational, tooling and process inefficienciesMaintain regular contact with customers during support and projectsProvide technical assistance and training to usersPerform routine operations including troubleshooting and resolving Tier 3 help desk tickets, performance monitoring, server monitoring, and log monitoringDeploy software packages to the Cloud One Integration, Test and Production environments. This also include supporting regression and other testing for the Cloud Common ServicesAddress security findings and vulnerabilities by developing, testing and deploying configuration changes. Provide integration support to developers. Perform activities for patch releases including configuration changes, required documentation and approvals. Develop code in Ansible, Terraform and Powershell for infrastructure automation and orchestration to support deployment, maintenance, and monitoring of the Cloud Common Services. Develop and test configurations to address performance issues and to reduce operational costs.Develop and update Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to provision and support Cloud One InfrastructureCreate and update documentation related to the maintenance and support of the Cloud Common ServicesQualificationsRequired Education and ExperienceBachelors and two (2) years or more experience; Additional years of experience will be considered in lieu of degree.Required Clearance And CertificationInterim Secret clearance required to start; Ability to obtain a Secret clearance required to maintain employment. Candidates may begin work with an Interim Secret ClearanceUS citizenship requiredSecurity + or higher certificationRequired SkillsKnowledge of deployments for Azure cloud systemsExperience/Knowledge of DevOpsInfrastructure as codeAgile, Scrum, SAFe or other modern software development methods/practicesTask AutomationVirtualization through containerization using Docker or KubernetesExperience working with Terraform, Powershell, and/or AnsibleDesired Skills And CertificationAzure or SAFe DevOps certificationExperience supporting USAF or USA software development projectsExperience in an MSP or other IT company highly desirableExperience with some of the following technologies Ansible; Jenkins, Java; Spring Framework; JavaScript; Apache Velocity; HTML (responsive for Live Portal); Tomcat Application Server; Oracle 11g, Oracle SQL - materialized views, SSH, Git (source control) Maven (build); Node/npm (building front-end)Experience with some of the following Active Directory, Data Factory, Cosmos DB, Virtual Machine, Azure SQL, Azure Function. Azure Policy, Federation Services (ADFS)SAIC accepts applications on an ongoing basis and there is no deadline.Covid Policy SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.

title: Model Based System Engineer
job_description: OverviewVTG is seeking a Model Based System Engineer to support work in our Charleston, SC office.What will you do?Assisting in the coordination and management of large organizations that require the effective use of money, materials, equipment, and people.Apply analytical methods from mathematics, science, and engineering.Operations research analysts may be concerned with diverse issues such as top-level strategy, planning, forecasting, resource allocation, performance measurement, scheduling, the design of production facilities and systems, supply chain management, pricing, transportation and distribution, and the analysis of large databases.Analysts gather information, then select the most appropriate analytical technique. Analysts can use any of several techniques, including simulation, linear and nonlinear programming, dynamic programming, queuing and other stochastic-process models, and the analytic hierarchy process. Most techniques involve the construction of mathematical models that attempt to describe the system being studied. The use of models enables the analyst to assign values to the different components and clarify the relationships among them. The values can be altered to examine what may happen to the system under different circumstances.Determine, find, and direct mission owners to the right service providersDo you have what it takes?Bachelors Degree in an Engineering or Mathematical fieldTen (10) years experience in operations researchExperience with SharePoint, Jira/Confluence, and Microsoft TeamsExperience in architecture, model, prototype, testing, and shareholder coordination (specifically pertaining to MCBOSS, Platform One/Black Pearl)

title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Who We Are…Management Solutions is a national award-winning management consulting firm that specializes in clean energy program management, organizational maturity assessment, environmental services, and project strategy and implementation. We deliver simple, innovative solutions to complex problems facing our federal customers. Founded in 2002, MSLLC has been named Small Business of the Year by the U.S. Small Business Administration, the Department of Energy, and the Oak Ridge National Laboratory. MSLLC has also been recognized as one of the Top Employers in the Greater Knoxville area.Who We Need…Management Solutions is seeking a Jr. Business Intelligence Analyst, you will work closely with the business, to deliver data-driven analytical insights and BI solutions of varying technologies that will help support and drive the decisions of the business. You will become a subject matter expert (SME) of our data systems, understand what data is available to the business, and help enforce data governance across our systems and BI products. This position is based in Knoxville, TN or Aiken, SC.Responsibilities:Partner with the business units to gather technical requirements and implement BI solutions. Develop and customize Power Apps and/or BI solutions to the needs of the client with an ability to assess tradeoffs of useability, efficiency, and efficacy. Maintain current reporting, subscriptions, and permissions in SSRS, Power BI, and other BI platforms. Develop reports, dashboards, scorecards, and other data visualizations in SSRS, Power BI, Excel, and other BI platformsUnify business logic and KPI definitions across all BI solutionsMaintain metadata and custom mappings used in reporting and analysisCoordinate with the Data & Analytics team to develop and document data warehouse collections and datasets needed for BI reporting and platforms. Analyze and understand source system data for validity and completeness, troubleshooting basic data integrity issues, and document findings. Maintain detailed data dictionaries, documentation, and source control for all BI processes and solutions. Provide end user training and support for BI platformsRemain current in profession and industry trends, learning new platforms as needed. Qualifications:Bachelor's degree required OR a graduate from reputable data/AI/coding (MOOC based) bootcampsBachelor’s degree specifically in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or another analytically challenging field preferred. Two (2) years of professional experience with SQL Server, SSRS, Microsoft Power Platform Tableau, and/or Tabular data modeling preferredProficiency at developing Power Apps and using Power Automate to streamline business operations. Familiarity with SharePoint functionality. Beginner understanding of dimensional data modeling (star schema). Moderate experience building dataflows, datasets, dashboards, and other visuals in Power BI, including use of DAX to create complex KPIs. Ability to develop an understanding of table relationships in a RDBMS by reverse engineering views and stored procedures. Familiarity with cloud analytics, data engineering, ETL/ELT processes, Kimball. methodologies of data warehousing concepts and design, and DDL & DML operations. Proficiency with Excel in a reporting and dashboarding capacity (Power Query, cube functions, array functions, etc.) Working knowledge of Python. Familiarity with Python’s data ecosystem of tools (pandas, numpy, matplotlib) for data processing and analytics. Ability to work independently and as part of a team, manage time effectively, and meet project deadlinesDesire to learn and support new technologies and systems. Experience in DOE environment is preferredDue to the nature of the government contract requirements and/or clearances requirements, US citizenship is requiredManagement Solutions LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. title: Manufacturing- ADAS-System Engineer
job_description: Scout MotorsHere at Scout Motors, we're carrying forward the heritage of one of the most iconic American vehicles in history. A vehicle dating back to 1960. One that forged the path for future generations of rugged SUVs and will do so once again.But Scout is more than just a brand, it’s a legacy steeped in a culture of exploration, caretaking, and hard work.Scout is all about respect. Respect for the environment by developing all-electric vehicles with the capability to get you to any location. Respect for the past and the future by taking an iconic American brand that hasn’t been around for a while, electrifying it, digitizing it, and loading it with American innovation. Respect for communities by creating a company that stands for its people and its customers. And respect for both work and play, with vehicles that are equally at home at a camp site, a job site, or on a Tuesday commute.At Scout Motors, we empower our talented, inclusive, and entrepreneurial teams to innovate. What makes a Scout? Someone who is a visionary and a leader, who seeks new paths and shares lessons learned. A knowledgeable doer who collaborates across the company to build better. A go-getter with unrivaled passion.Join us at Scout Motors and be part of shaping the future of transportation. If you're ready to drive change and make history, apply now!What you’ll doWithin the Manufacturing Engineering scope, Product Engineering evaluates, reports, and achieves manufacturability KPI’s by consulting with R&D on optimal product design.Success is achieved by intimate knowledge of product design, production process and project management. The Manufacturing- ADAS-System Engineer” is responsible for parts such ADAS sensors and their interaction with Vehicle Body. You will report to the Manager, Drive system at Production Planning.Become part of an iconic brand that is set to revolutionize the all-electric pick-up truck & rugged SUV marketplace by achieving the following:Your goal is to improve the product, design the vehicles according to the needs of manufacturing, and enable stable and ergonomic processes that are feasible for high-volume manufacturingIdentify, decide, and implement technical requirements from manufacturing to influence product designCollaborate with manufacturing, quality, production control, and engineering to provide product design and product concepts according to the needs of ADAS integration. Use Data-Analysis, Simulations and virtual tests to identify risks for high-volume manufacturingIdentify and implement ideas to improve product design to ensure stable assembly processes and minimal rework in series productionTake responsibility for all communication between production planning assembly and engineering department as a single point-of-contact for all vehicle design related topicsUse cross departmental collaboration to meet and exceed company goals and objectives in the field of design for manufacturingCoordinating activities within the team that outline and achieve project goals. Providing instruction and guidance about required techniques and regulationsLocation & Travel Expectations: The responsibilities of this role require daily attendance at in-person meetings and events. The role will be based out of a Scout Motors location in Columbia, South Carolina, starting 2025. Until then, you will be required to be in the Detroit, MI area frequently. Applicants should expect the role to require the ability to convene with Scout colleagues in person and travel to participate in events on the company's behalf.What you’ll bringWe expect all Scouts to have integrity, curiosity, resourcefulness, and strive to exhibit a positive attitude, as well as a growth mindset. You’ll be comfortable with change and flexible in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. You’ll take a collaborative approach to achieve ambitious goals. Here’s what else you’ll bring:5+ years professional experience with expertise in manufacturing engineering or production planning (General Assembly), including ability to achieve stable production processesDeep knowledge of vehicle engineering processes, knowledge of ADAS and its implementation. Bachelor’s/ Master’s degree in mechanical, electrical engineering or equivalentSkillful at organizational and cross-functional collaboration at all levels; ability to develop effective partnerships and relationships. Creative and strategic problem solver who exercises sound judgment. What you'll gainThe benefits of joining Scout include the chance to build products and a company from the ground up. This is a chance to create something new and lasting – with an iconic brand at its foundation. In addition, Scout provides competitive compensation and benefits to support your physical, mental, and financial wellbeing. Program specifics are detailed in company policies and employee benefit guides, select highlights:    Competitive insurance including:Medical, dental, vision and income protection plans401(k) program with:An employer match and immediate vestingGenerous Paid Time Off including:20 days planned PTO, as accrued40 hours of unplanned PTO and 14 company or floating holidays, annuallyUp to 16 weeks of paid parental leave for biological and adoptive parents of all gendersPaid leave for circumstances related to bereavement, jury duty, voting time, or military leaveCorporate Vehicle Program with:Eligibility to lease up to 2 vehicles at competitive ratesPay TransparencyThis is a full-time, exempt position eligible to receive a base salary and to participate in an annual performance bonus program. The salary range listed represents the maximum and minimum starting base pay for this position as of the time of posting. Final salary offered will be determined based on factors including but not limited to the candidate's skills and experience. The annual performance bonus program is preset and not candidate dependent.Initial base salary range: $110,000 - $130,000Internal leveling code: IC9Notice to applicants:Residing in San Francisco: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Scout Motors will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Residing in Los Angeles: Scout Motors will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. title: Manufacturing- Drive-System Engineer
job_description: Scout MotorsHere at Scout Motors, we're carrying forward the heritage of one of the most iconic American vehicles in history. A vehicle dating back to 1960. One that forged the path for future generations of rugged SUVs and will do so once again.But Scout is more than just a brand, it’s a legacy steeped in a culture of exploration, caretaking, and hard work.Scout is all about respect. Respect for the environment by developing all-electric vehicles with the capability to get you to any location. Respect for the past and the future by taking an iconic American brand that hasn’t been around for a while, electrifying it, digitizing it, and loading it with American innovation. Respect for communities by creating a company that stands for its people and its customers. And respect for both work and play, with vehicles that are equally at home at a camp site, a job site, or on a Tuesday commute.At Scout Motors, we empower our talented, inclusive, and entrepreneurial teams to innovate. What makes a Scout? Someone who is a visionary and a leader, who seeks new paths and shares lessons learned. A knowledgeable doer who collaborates across the company to build better. A go-getter with unrivaled passion.Join us at Scout Motors and be part of shaping the future of transportation. If you're ready to drive change and make history, apply now!What you’ll doWithin the Manufacturing Engineering scope, Product Engineering evaluates, reports, and achieves manufacturability KPI’s by consulting with R&D on optimal product design.Success is achieved by intimate knowledge of product design, production process and project management. The “Manufacturing- Drive System Engineer” is responsible for parts such as axles, brakes, Drive units, cooling system and ADAS sensors. You will report to the Manager, Drive System at Production Planning.Become part of an iconic brand that is set to revolutionize the all-electric pick-up truck & rugged SUV marketplace by achieving the following:Your goal is to improve the product, design the vehicles according to the needs of manufacturing and to enable stable and ergonomic processes that are feasible for high volume manufacturingIdentify, decide and implement technical requirements from manufacturing to influence product designCollaborate with manufacturing, quality, production control, and engineering to provide product design and product concepts according to the needs of Chassis Assembly. Use CAD-Data-Analysis, Simulations and virtual tests to identify risks for high volume manufacturingIdentify and implement ideas to improve product design to ensure stable assembly processes and minimal rework in series productionEnsure that all products are designed to meet assembly requirements and that product design is feasible for high volume manufacturingTake responsibility for all communication between production planning assembly and engineering department as Single point of contact for all vehicle design related topicsUse cross departmental collaboration to meet and exceed company goals and objectives in the field of design for manufacturingCoordinating activities within the team that outline and achieve project goals. Providing instruction and guidance about required techniques and regulations. Location & Travel Expectations: The responsibilities of this role require attendance at in-person meetings and events regularly. The role will be based out of a Scout Motors location in Columbia, SC. Applicants should expect that the role may require the ability to travel to participate in events on behalf of the company from time to time.What you’ll bringWe expect all Scouts to have integrity, curiosity, resourcefulness, and strive to exhibit a positive attitude, as well as a growth mindset. You’ll be comfortable with change and flexible in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. You’ll take a collaborative approach to achieve ambitious goals. Here’s what else you’ll bring:3+ years professional experience with expertise in manufacturing engineering or production planning (General Assembly), including ability to achieve stable production processes. Deep knowledge of vehicle engineering processesBachelor’s / master’s degree in mechanical, electrical engineering or equivalent. Skillful at organizational navigation and cross-functional collaboration at all levels; ability to develop effective partnerships and relationships. Creative and strategic problem solver who exercises sound judgment. What you'll gainThe benefits of joining Scout include the chance to build products and a company from the ground up. This is a chance to create something new and lasting – with an iconic brand at its foundation. In addition, Scout provides competitive compensation and benefits to support your physical, mental, and financial wellbeing. Program specifics are detailed in company policies and employee benefit guides, select highlights:    Competitive insurance including:Medical, dental, vision and income protection plans401(k) program with:An employer match and immediate vestingGenerous Paid Time Off including:20 days planned PTO, as accrued40 hours of unplanned PTO and 14 company or floating holidays, annuallyUp to 16 weeks of paid parental leave for biological and adoptive parents of all gendersPaid leave for circumstances related to bereavement, jury duty, voting time, or military leaveCorporate Vehicle Program with:Eligibility to lease up to 2 vehicles at competitive ratesPay TransparencyThis is a full-time, exempt position eligible to receive a base salary and to participate in an annual performance bonus program. The salary range listed represents the maximum and minimum starting base pay for this position as of the time of posting. Final salary offered will be determined based on factors including but not limited to the candidate's skills and experience. The annual performance bonus program is preset and not candidate dependent.Initial base salary range: $110,000 - $130,000Internal leveling code: IC9Notice to applicants:Residing in San Francisco: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Scout Motors will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Residing in Los Angeles: Scout Motors will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. Residing in New York City: This role is not eligible for remote work in New York City. Equal OpportunityScout is committed to employing a diverse workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, or any other characteristics protected by law. title: Sensor Fusion Engineer
job_description: About the job What we do Integer Technologies is an applied research and product development company founded by scientists and engineers with a passion for technology and national security. We perform R&D on next-generation systems and technologies for the Department of Defense and other U.S. Government agencies. We are hardware and software developers with experience turning research into impactful products for military and commercial applications. Our core portfolio of research includes projects in controls and automation for electrical and machinery systems, perception systems for uncrewed vehicles (with an emphasis on maritime vehicles), digital twins and autonomy, and advanced manufacturing. We are a startup founded for the purpose of putting research into action. Our mission is to create a safer world by translating scientific discoveries into reliable products that address urgent national security needs… at the speed of relevance. Our perception systems portfolio includes work on critical enabling technologies for more reliable, more intelligent, and longer-duration uncrewed vehicles. We are actively developing a new perception system for ships that automatically detects objects on and just below the surface of the water, day or night, and in most weather conditions, by fusing sensor data from multi-spectral cameras and radar using reliable and validated computer vision algorithms. This perception system will be a key enabler for uncrewed ships to navigate safely without human intervention.   About the Role Integer seeks a Sensor Fusion Engineer with experience developing disparate camera, lidar, radar, IMU, and AIS sensor implementations into fused monolithic integrated systems for the Perception team. The Sensor Fusion Engineer will apply this experience at Integer Technologies toward prototyping new technology enabling uncrewed surface vessels (USVs) to understand their operating environment and navigate while avoiding obstacles and collisions. Experience with perception systems, rapid prototyping and epipolar integration for maritime vehicle applications, or the ability to transfer knowledge from other vehicles to the maritime domain is important.   Primary Responsibilities Provide technical subject matter expertise for the Company’s projects related to maritime environments with autonomous perception and sensor fusion for Autonomous Surface Vessels. Leverage experience with autonomous perception to design and implement multi-sensor arrays (electro-optical, infrared, radar, lidar) and fuse them into a combined world space surrounding a ship to improve autonomous navigation. Use prior experience with hands-on testing to develop and prototype sensor hardware, optimize builds, and test systems end to end to validate system performance. Research and develop electro-optical, radar, and lidar arrays and analyze sensor fusion techniques for valid metrics and relative effectiveness. Quickly iterate and deploy rapidly fabricated prototypes of data collection hardware to meet research project requirements. Provide domain knowledge for autonomous perception systems including technical analysis, experimental development, engineering, and product development. Execute individual medium-long term (e.g., monthly to quarterly) tasking with minimal oversight, delays, or rework. Proactively recommend your own medium-long term tasking to project leads. Communicate estimated time to complete tasks with infrequent need to extend and demonstrate sound time management. Proactively understand required technical work and address problems with minimal required oversight. Develop key content for deliverables including monthly reports, quarterly project reviews, and demonstration events. Regularly exercise technical prudence. Coordinate junior engineers to achieve medium term tasking. Support the Company as needed to develop new funded research and development projects. This includes, but is not limited to, engaging with government stakeholders to understand priorities and gaps related to the Company’s capabilities͕ supporting the development of white papers and proposals and building relationships with university and industry partners. Embody Integer’s core values: Integrity, Agility, Growth, Open-Mindedness, Commitment.  Qualification Requirements Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain a US DoD Secret clearance. Deep understanding of topics in sensor fusion, autonomous vehicles / robotics, rapid prototyping and perception sensor solutions. Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, or related technical discipline. 2+ years of industry experience as an engineer working on hardware design, system architecture, image/sensor analysis, perception sensors such as cameras and radar, and on vehicle computing. Strong working knowledge of low-level software development using modern C++ and Python where applicable to develop and rapidly integrate sensor systems. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to travel occasionally, estimated at less than 10% of the time.  Additional Desired Qualifications Experience working on other aspects of autonomous vehicles, such as autonomous navigation and path planning. Experience with maritime autonomy (e.g., autonomous surface vessels or autonomous underwater vehicles). Masters or Ph.D. in computer vision, robotics, autonomous vehicles, sensor fusion, mechanical design, or related field. Track record of transitioning to production from R&D. Company Benefits Integer fully covers medical, prescription, vision, and dental insurance costs for the employee and dependents. Meaning Integer standard plan pays 100% of health insurance premiums for your entire family from a well-known national insurer, saving its employee’s thousands of dollars annually. Relocation assistance available. Base salaries which exceed local & national industry averages. Year-end performance-based bonuses. 401(k) with company matching that vest immediately; no funny business. Paid Vacation Paid Sick Leave Paid Holidays  Company Perks Startup culture with the stability of a large company. Integer’s business plan has years of time phased contracted work, alleviating the would-be risk from a traditional small company. Direct access to company leadership, prioritization of people over process, and a stellar team with a shared desire for personal and professional growth. Friendly atmosphere where people enjoy not only their work and what they're creating but enjoy helping each other as well. Bottomless Coffee!

Occasional night or weekend work for special projects.EEO Statement ACA provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.You are not officially considered an applicant unless you have completed an employment application in ACA's online applicant tracking system, iCIMS.

title: Data Mapping Validation Analyst (On-site)
job_description: Who We AreShellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.Primary FunctionContribute to the Mapping, Validation and Activations team in Loan Transfers. Ensure all loan transfer data mapping is completed according to existing processes and procedures. Maintain all SLAs within the transfer timeline while aiming for zero defects within the transfer. Act as the accountable party for all assigned data mapping from start to finish. Data Mapping is responsible for all data that is loaded into Servicing Director for transfers assigned to the analyst. Responsible for loan data, payment histories, and comments being added to all incoming loans. Work with the Supervisor to create, document and enforce department policies, procedures, and SLA’s.Principal DutiesUtilize Servicing Director Import Tool (SDI) to seamlessly map all data from prior servicers to SMS systems.Perform data analysis by SQL scripts to ensure a smooth transition of data from external sources to internal systems.Conduct data validation reviews by collaborating with business units who are the owners of the data.Activate loans per the schedule set by the Deal Managers to ensure legal and contractual compliance. Maintain stated performance level for all assigned transfer mapping and validation.Key contact for the Servicing Director Import Tool (SDI).Follow established processes within the group to ensure maximum efficiency of the process and other company resources.Maintain and update exceptions in SDI from SCSM tickets submitted to improve quality downstream.Develop update exceptions in SDI regarding transfer errors and work with the Portfolio Management and Deal Management groups to improve processes and eliminate upstream transfer errors.Contribute to the creation, manage, and deliver reporting to senior management of the timeliness and accuracy of the group.Assign SCSM tickets to Deal Managers and individual business units for data sign-off for all preliminary data mapping within stated SLA.Run automated review checks for all transfers at prelim and final for all assigned transfers.Responsible for each assigned transfer meeting the established mapping SLAs.Balance all transfers from loan set-up prior to activation using the designed process and form.Other tasks or responsibilities as assigned by management. Performs additional projects and duties as assigned by supervisor.Education And Experience RequirementsCollege or university degree in the field of Business, Data Analysis, computer science, process improvement, project management, etc. 2-4 years’ experience in the field.Knowledge, Skill, and Ability RequirementsTypical work schedule is Monday – Friday, 8:00 – 5:00 with some minor flexibility.Certain after hours/weekend work may be necessary for projects or high business volume situations.After hours/ weekend email monitoring to ensure internal, client and homeowner satisfaction with transfers. Up to 10% travel to other company locations for projects, training, etc. While this description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position’s requirements, it in no way implies/states that these are the only job responsibilities. Management reserves the right to modify, add or remove duties and request other duties, as necessary. The Afloat Submarine C4I IPT Common Submarine Radio Room (CSRR) Multi-purpose Reconfigurable Training System (MRTS) team is seeking an Engineer, Software III in Charleston, SC.Afloat Submarine C4I IPT Common Submarine Radio Room (CSRR) Multi-purpose Reconfigurable Training System (MRTS) is the Naval Information Warfare Systems Command (NAVWAR) Program Executive Office (PEO) C4I model to provide seamless, end-to-end communications training supporting the Sailor 2025, Ready Relevant Learning initiative. providing reports in appropriate formats.Support system (software/hardware/network/configuration and data management) operations and system administration, integration, and data transfer for modeling and performance modeling simulation tools, architecture tools, and data repositories within the NAVWAR Model-Based Systems Engineer (MBSE) environment.Ensure that MBSE tools are used to model, update, and maintain operational architecture to satisfy the requirements and identified capabilities as well as design specifications, functions, and performance requirements.Utilize software automated title: F5 Engineer
job_description: ***Must have active Secret level Government clearance or higher to be considered.***NexGen Data Systems is seeking an F5 Engineer with experience administrating application delivery networking solutions including local load balancing and acceleration, global (DNS based) load balancing and acceleration, security through web application firewall and application authentication and access products for both datacenter and cloud applications. The ideal candidate would be versed in administration of the F5 BIG-IP LTM, BIP-IP DNS, APM, ASM, Reverse Web Proxy (RWP) to include Department of Defense (DoD) Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) application authentication and SSL break and inspect, networking, virtualization, and security best practices. The candidate will be expected to have a general understanding of data center design concepts and subsystems (i.e. storage, network, security, orchestration/automation, backup, disaster recovery) as they relate to application delivery networking solutions deployed across geographically dispersed private data centers and commercial public cloud platforms (such as AWS, Azure). The candidate will join a team of engineers and administrators and work in a collaborative multi-functional team environment. Relevant network and security certifications are required.Roles and Responsibilities:Perform routine administrative and maintenance functions (install, configure, patch, update, etc.) F5 platforms.Support and creation of iRules on F5 Load balancers.Creation of Virtual Servers, Pools, iRules, Nodes, etc.Creation of Monitors, Address Translations, and Traffic Class.Creation of Device Groups and Device Trust with Trust, CA Certificates, Identity Certificates, and Traffic Groups.Configure Network parameters including, interfaces, Routes, Self IP’s, Packet Filters, Trunks, Tunnels, VLANs, etc.Configure system parameters including, Configuration, Device Certificates, File/Disk/Software Management, License Updates, Users, etc.Management and creation of SSL certificates, both self-signed and third party signed, within the application environment.Perform security hardening and work with IA/C&A teams to conduct security scans/audits.Troubleshoot F5 platforms in preproduction and production environments.Monitor performance of remote and local systems to identify problems, and if needed, perform analysis to identify root cause of any performance issues and take appropriate corrective action to resolve issues.Develop scripts to automate manual tasks.Work with application owners and infrastructure team members (network, storage, IA, etc.) to optimize system performance.Participate in the development and maintenance of system lifecycle documentation.Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.RequirementsDesired/Required Skills:BS degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or Computer Science/Information Systems Technology and minimum of 6 years industry IT experience or Technical Training in relevant enterprise hosting technology areas and 10 years hands on DoD industry IT Experience.5+ years of network experience working in data center or enterprise environments is desired.2+ years of experience with F5 platforms is required.Experience with F5 and creation of application specific iRules is required.Secret clearance or higher preferred8570 compliance (Active Security and OS certifications)Experience in managing SSL certificates is required.Strong log analysis and troubleshooting skills are required.Experience with network monitoring/management platforms.Strong written and oral communication skills.Ability to work cooperatively in a multi-functional team environment (team player) is required.Compliance with current government cybersecurity workforce requirements (current relevant network and security certifications) is required.Additional network related certifications are desired.Additional security related certifications are desired.Experience with DoD security requirements is desired.Experience with network management and monitoring tools.Other requirements:Exposure to and familiarity with data center design including systems, storage and networking.A strong sense of urgency including self-governance on task priority.About the Company:NexGen Data Systems is an emerging technologies focused company providing expert systems and network engineering solutions to the Department of Defense. NexGen Data Systems promotes a culture of knowledge and career advancement through continued learning, keeping our team current on the latest advances in systems and networking, and enabling our team to provide the best available solutions to our clients.Benefits:Company covers 100% of premiums for the employee’s medical, dental, and vision insurance and subsidizes premiums for spouse and dependents.Company provides short and long term disability plans.401(k) match up to 10% of the employee’s salary contributions to 401(K) plan.Comprehensive training and development program.11 paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) accrual level starts at 15 days annually.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.NOTE: US Citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. In order to be qualified for this position, you must be able to obtain and maintain a United States Department of Defense (DoD) security clearance. We are unable to sponsor Visas at this time. NexGen Data Systems provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

title: Data Scientist
job_description: OverviewAmerican Credit Acceptance seeks a highly-skilled, analytical Data Scientist to join the Data Science and Learning Team. The Data Scientist will leverage their advanced knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques and their entrepreneurial mindset to uncover insights, build solutions, and deliver recommendations to the business.American Credit Acceptance is a rapidly-expanding company with extensive growth opportunities. We are proud to say, that we have experienced double digit growth for the last 10 years and currently have over $5,000,000,000 in assets. Our team members and corporate culture create a positive workplace that drives us to succeed, making American Credit Acceptance one of the top auto finance companies in the US for the emerging credit consumer. We offer a great work environment, awesome team members, competitive benefits, progressive career opportunities, a business casual dress code and we work hard to ensure every team member is empowered to work to their fullest potential.ResponsibilitiesReasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Analyze large amounts of structured and unstructured data using scientific methods and algorithms to develop knowledge and insights and improve business performance in impact areas including pricing modeling, financial returns, web analytics, call analytics, speech analytics, fraud analytics, forecasting, and auction analysis.  Understand and apply mathematical theory by developing and leveraging predictive models, boosted models, decision trees/Random forests, Support Vector Machine (SVM), neural networks/deep learning, regression modeling, experimental design, and other techniques.  Leverage R, Python, SQL, Tableau, and other quantitative analytical techniques to extract and manipulate data, as well as to develop, analyze, validate and deploy predictive models.  Engage across functional areas, including Operations, Legal, Compliance, Informational Technology, Vendor Management, and Finance to develop an understanding of fields to which statistical methods are to be applied and to determine which methods and results are appropriate.  Leverage statistical models and collaborate closely with technology and business groups to analyze operational feasibility, implementation, and production integration.  Develop profitability analyses to assess the financial value of new models.  Develop monitoring of model inputs, sampling techniques, and performance and make changes to models when needed.  Create statistically derived tests to grow business knowledge and measure the impact of hypotheses.  Research and evaluate advanced statistical techniques using machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to advance knowledge and pursue new approaches.  Report results of statistical analyses and present written recommendations in a clear manner to senior executives.  Consistently consider, and follow, ACA’s Guiding Principles Qualifications Bachelor’s or higher degree (or its equivalent) in Mathematics, Statistics, or a related analytical field with exceptional academic performance (3.4 or higher GPA)  Experience validating and monitoring models using statistical techniques and KPIs relevant in a business environment  Exceptional written and verbal communication, specifically, the ability to convey results to both technical, and non-technical, audiences effectively  Ability to manage multiple projects/tasks and prioritize them based on impact  The ability to quickly assess problems and find workable solutions within a business framework (understanding that added complexity does not always lead to added performance) ACA’s Guiding PrinciplesTo be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate the characteristics our Guiding Principles:Integrity - Conduct all business in an honest, forthright, and ethical manner.Partnership - Honor commitments and develop enduring relationships grounded in mutual trust, respect, service, and reliability. This applies to customers, teammates, investors, financial partners, vendors, and our communities.Humility - Recognize what we do not know, actively seek knowledge and guidance in our decision making, and acknowledge, learn and grown from our mistakes.Principled Entrepreneurship - Create long-term value by anticipating opportunities for profitable growth, satisfying the evolving needs of the customer, and embracing change while striving for continuous improvement. Exercise sound judgment and take calculated risks to deliver superior results.Initiative - Be decisive and passionately pursue opportunities with a sense of urgency while continuously adapting and refining strategies.Fulfillment - Reach our full potential by developing our talents, earning meaningful responsibility, and overcoming challenges as a team, and find purpose in the positive impact we have on our business, family, and community.Work Environment and Physical DemandsThis job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. This position is required to lift at least 50 pounds and have the mobility to keep the storage areas orderly and floors cleaned of IT clutter.Position Type/Expected Hours of WorkThis is a full-time position with a work schedule of Monday-Friday with some schedule variations as needed including on-call coverage rotation. Occasional night or weekend work for special projects.ACA provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employmentEEO Statement ACA provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. ACA complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.You are not officially considered an applicant unless you have completed an employment application in ACA's online applicant tracking system, iCIMS.

title: Senior C++ Software Engineer - Charleston
job_description: Our client is a global leader in quantitative trading. They are seeking experienced Senior C++ Software Engineers to join their team, to build and maintain their high-performance trading and research systems.Responsibilities Designing and implementing a high-performance, stable, and robust trading platform and/or data research platform  Optimising the trading platform using advanced techniques such as system and network programming  Building tools for risk management, performance tracking, and data analysis Requirements- C++ experience is required, daily use (of most recent standards) preferred, at least 5 years in a professional (ie non-academic) setting Recent (within the past 3 years) experience as a trading system developer within a quantitative trading firm  A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or similar  Excellent design, debugging, troubleshooting and problem solving skills and attention to detail  Proficiency with Python, Bash shell scripting, SQL, Java and/or Perl is a plus  Experience with latency optimization  Deep knowledge of the Linux operating system, system/processor performance, and network communication  Strong English communication skills (both written and verbal)  Can describe software designs at a high level (the abstract interface), low level (step-by-step algorithm), or anywhere in between  A collaborative approach to research, development, design, and optimisation  A passion for new technologies and ideas

title: Quality System Engineer
job_description: JOB SUMMARYMaintains the Quality Management System and Operations Manual, ensuring policies and procedures are current and in compliance with relevant standards. Gathers data and information, including audit findings, customer complaints, and customer surveys, necessary to assess the performance of the QMS. Makes recommendations regarding system improvements and training required. title: Engineer III/Sr Engineer
job_description: Job DescriptionWindstream Holdings, Inc., is a leading provider of advanced network communications and technology solutions for consumers, small businesses, enterprise organizations and carrier partners across the U.S.As Kinetic, Windstream offers bundled services, including premium broadband, security solutions, voice, and digital TV to consumers through an enhanced fiber network.Windstream Enterprise is a leading managed services provider providing strategic communications and security products to mid-size businesses and enterprise clients. Windstream Wholesale provides high-capacity, high-performance networking solutions and services to other telecom carriers, data centers, content providers and enterprises. The Windstream team provides innovative software and network solutions to connect people and empower business in a world of infinite possibilities!_________________________________________________________ About The RoleThe Sr Engineer is responsible for improving the Kinetic customer experience by leveraging and creating software solutions to automate resolution of repetitive and complex network challenges. This position will be part of a team responsible for improving the customer experience through expedited resolution and long-term stability via analyzing service impacting events, automation development, tools improvement, and network reliability efforts. What You’ll Do: Responsible for organizing complex activities for the development, implementation, and maintenance of engineering projects Performs analysis and studies to determine requirements, immediate and long-range plans, and designs Utilize a wide range of experience, including professional concepts and company objectives to resolve issues in creative and effective ways Acts as a technical consultant within and outside assigned department in area of expertise; regarded as subject matter expert Utilize high level of communication and interpersonal skills to establish and maintain positive and productive working relationships Operate with considerable latitude for unreviewed action or decision May perform engineering design evaluations including cost-effective utilization of materials May design, develop, test, and implement all components, equipment, and software within the functional area of the organization Other administrative work relating to projects and assignments may be assigned Promote positive change in the company's business strategy through achievement of customer specific objectives and technological innovation of practical and profitable nature Do You Have? In depth understanding of the telecommunications industry Extensive knowledge of one or more engineering disciplines and vendor equipment In depth knowledge of accepted engineering practices Familiarity with navigating legacy code bases: refactoring old code, applying new design patterns, and using best practices are a must Computer software knowledge to include Microsoft Office, custom planning tools and databases Excellent analytical, oral, and written communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills Well-developed leadership qualities Excellent project management skills, including the ability to prioritize projects Even Better: Ability to stay current with the economic and technological developments in the industry Possess a broad understanding of the network infrastructure Experience writing clean and maintainable code Exposure to developing monitoring processes for all services, network performance, network maintenance, facilities management, and overall network performance/reliability Ability to monitor networks via SNMP, telnet, and SSH Experience with recommending cost-effective improvements to existing processes or solutions to new challenges Skilled in analyzing fault trends and providing solutions to mitigate Capable of establishing and maintaining documentation of internal processes and procedures Ability to exercise independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance Minimum Requirements: College degree and 5-7 years experience or 9 + years equivalent related Engineering/Technical experience or a combination of education and related Engineering/Technical experience required. title: Lead Electrical System Integration Engineer
job_description: Job Description Summary The Electrical System Integration Leader is part of the onshore wind product design process and is a key person for successful, high quality NPI execution.You will demonstrate technical accountability and cross-functional leadership for the electrical system of one of our globally used wind turbine platforms. You will lead product development projects, from business requirement definition and technical trade-offs to prototype installation and serial production.The teams scope includes the overall electrical system of our wind turbine products and its components like Generators, Transformers, Power Conductors, Cable Harnesses, Converters, Electrical Switchgears & Control Cabinets etc.The broad scope of the team and the global responsibilities of this position provide great opportunity to drive engineering excellence and quality, as well as to optimize the wind turbine electrical system with respect to performance, cost and reliability. Job Description Essential ResponsibilitiesLead and drive the execution of Engineering design work on onshore NPI programs. E.g. cost out, services programs, new products, etc.Lead the execution of the design, analysis, and evaluation of assigned projects using sound engineering principles, adhering to business standards, practices, procedures, and product/program requirements.Responsible for interfacing with cross functional teams inside and outside of engineering to execute NPI program deliverables within cost and schedule targets.Plan & organize technical program reviews and participate as a presenter or reviewer.Ensure the electrical system functionality and/or capability meets product requirements, through a clear breakdown of overall requirements to the electrical system and its components.Support the platform team in driving decisions on utilizing existing components or identifying strategic uprates.Provide timely communication on significant issues, necessary changes to the plan and achievements, as well as providing recommendations on next moves.Assure proper documentation of technical data generated for the assigned projects and/or tasks, in consistency with engineering policies and procedures.Required QualificationsBachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering (or equivalent).Ability and willingness to travel 10% of the time.Desired CharacteristicsBroad electrical engineering experience and/or in other, related fields.Familiar with the characteristics, capabilities and limiting factors of the electrical system of a wind turbine or other electrical systems of similar complexity.Ability to pull together teams across functions to drive consensus and decisions.Program Management skills, experience and attitude.Positive mindset with excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to work in a cross-functional, global environment.Wind turbine product knowledge and responsibility.Analytical approach to problem solving.Ability to document, plan, and execute multiple NPI program deliverables in parallel.Good interpersonal and leadership skills.The salary range for this position is $85,600 - $142,600 USD Annual.
